snippet: Concerned that the Libertarian presidential candidate Gary Johnson could hurt the Romney campaign, Republicans across the country have been working to keep him off the ballot.
abstract: Republicans, concerned that Gary Johnson, former two-term Republican governor of New Mexico now campaigning as the Libertarian Party’s presidential nominee could hurt the Romney campaign, have been working to keep him off the ballot; Johnson is on the ballot in every state except Michigan and Oklahoma and is trying to tap into the same grass-roots enthusiasm that helped build a big following for Rep Ron Paul.
lead_paragraph: Concerned that the Libertarian presidential candidate Gary Johnson could hurt the Romney campaign, Republicans across the country have been working to keep him off the ballot.

headline.seo: Gary Johnson Libertarian Candidate Worries Republicans
headline.main: Spoiler Alert! G.O.P. Fighting Libertarian’s Spot on the Ballot
headline.print_headline: Spoiler Alert! G.O.P. Fighting Libertarian’s Spot on the Ballot
